intro: Argythamnia salina, commonly known as the saltbush, is a halophytic shrub adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. The plant has small, scale-like leaves that reduce water loss and are often covered in a waxy cuticle. It produces small greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Argythamnia salina is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in salty and degraded areas.
